body:
I was wondering what your thoughts are on churches that express resounding patriotism and hanging up symbols of a nation as opposed to church symbols.

This past memorial day, flags were lined in the parking lots and next to the pulpits and I just think of the misplaced expression of memorializing fallen soldiers.  It's the nation that is at fault for our young men dying. They died because of political and economic interests of our elites... led astray by the propaganda and lies by the government.  It's ironic to hold up national flags in remembrance of the fallen. It's satanic to fly a government symbol in church - especially in glory of war.
body_html:
I was wondering what your thoughts are on churches that express resounding patriotism and hanging up symbols of a nation as opposed to church symbols.

It's the nation that is at fault for our young men dying. They died because of political and economic interests of our elites... led astray by the propaganda and lies by the government. It's ironic to hold up national flags in remembrance of the fallen. It's satanic to fly a government symbol in church - especially in glory of war.
title: Patriotism and the church

body: I hate upon and refuse to attend or acknowledge the legitimacy of churches that fly government flags. Isay "idolatry" instead of satanic but ultimately, sure.  The splendor of th kingdoms of the earth belongs to Satan according to fucking Jesus and the gospel, comeon
body_html: I hate upon and refuse to attend or acknowledge the legitimacy of churches that fly government flags. Isay "idolatry" instead of satanic but ultimately, sure. The splendor of th kingdoms of the earth belongs to Satan according to fucking Jesus and the gospel, comeon

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: Common symbols associated with church are the Dove, Fish, Cross, Flame, Loaf and Cup, Shepherd's hook, alpha and omega, crown, and the triquerta - all in rebellion of the state as that what Christianity is.

body:
Oh, ok, when you mentioned church symbols I imagined symbols of denominations (idk why) 

I honestly don't think that its bad to have national symbols alongside the church symbols, as long as the priority is on the latter.

Faith, Hope, and Love is the path to Life, Liberty, and Happiness.

There is no justification for any human authority.
author.bio_html:
Faith, Hope, and Love is the path to Life, Liberty, and Happiness.

body: good thing, lets hope it stays that way for the sake of an uncorrupted Christianity...
body_html: good thing, lets hope it stays that way for the sake of an uncorrupted Christianity...

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.body:
I was wondering what your thoughts are on churches that express resounding patriotism and hanging up symbols of a nation as opposed to church symbols.

This past memorial day, flags were lined in the parking lots and next to the pulpits and I just think of the misplaced expression of memorializing fallen soldiers.  It's the nation that is at fault for our young men dying. They died because of political and economic interests of our elites... led astray by the propaganda and lies by the government.  It's ironic to hold up national flags in remembrance of the fallen. It's satanic to fly a government symbol in church - especially in glory of war.
post.body_html:

body: Most church, at least in America, is actually just traditionalist clubs who are nostalgic for earlier eras of American history. They only identify as Christian because that's what the dominant faith was in those times, not out of true conviction. For as much as they hate them it's exactly the same thing Catholics did with Rome.
body_html: Most church, at least in America, is actually just traditionalist clubs who are nostalgic for earlier eras of American history. They only identify as Christian because that's what the dominant faith was in those times, not out of true conviction. For as much as they hate them it's exactly the same thing Catholics did with Rome.

I honestly don't think that its bad to have national symbols alongside the church symbols, as long as the priority is on the latter.

author.bio: Sometimes the best way to solve your own problems is to help someone else.
author.bio_html: Sometimes the best way to solve your own problems is to help someone else.

body:
Flags and symbols outside the church, or in the foyer? Fine! In the sanctuary or (gasp!) on the alter? Very sus.

Patriotism is in general a good thing, as long as it does not lead to idolatry. To quote GK Chesterton:

> Let us suppose we are confronted with a desperate thing – say Pimlico. If we think what is really best for Pimlico we shall find the thread of thought leads to the throne of the mystic and the arbitrary. It is not enough for a man to disapprove of Pimlico; in that case he will merely cut his throat or move to Chelsea. Nor, certainly, is it enough for a man to approve of Pimlico; for then it will remain Pimlico, which would be awful. The only way out of it seems to be for somebody to love Pimlico; to love it with a transcendental tie and without any earthly reason. If there arose a man who loved Pimlico, then Pimlico would rise into ivory towers and golden pinnacles… If men loved Pimlico as mothers love children, arbitrarily, because it is theirs, Pimlico in a year or two might be fairer than Florence. Some readers will say that this is mere fantasy. I answer that this is the actual history of mankind. This, as a fact, is how cities did grow great. Go back to the darkest roots of civilization and you will find them knotted round some sacred stone or encircling some sacred well. People first paid honour to a spot and afterwards gained glory for it. Men did not love Rome because she was great. She was great because they had loved her.

Do you love America because God has given you her to love and care for? That is wonderful! But do not let it become idolatry, where you love America more than God.

Let us suppose we are confronted with a desperate thing – say Pimlico. If we think what is really best for Pimlico we shall find the thread of thought leads to the throne of the mystic and the arbitrary. The only way out of it seems to be for somebody to love Pimlico; to love it with a transcendental tie and without any earthly reason. If there arose a man who loved Pimlico, then Pimlico would rise into ivory towers and golden pinnacles… If men loved Pimlico as mothers love children, arbitrarily, because it is theirs, Pimlico in a year or two might be fairer than Florence. Some readers will say that this is mere fantasy. I answer that this is the actual history of mankind. This, as a fact, is how cities did grow great. Go back to the darkest roots of civilization and you will find them knotted round some sacred stone or encircling some sacred well. Do you love America because God has given you her to love and care for? That is wonderful! But do not let it become idolatry, where you love America more than God.

This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.name: Christianity

post.body:
I was wondering what your thoughts are on churches that express resounding patriotism and hanging up symbols of a nation as opposed to church symbols.

This past memorial day, flags were lined in the parking lots and next to the pulpits and I just think of the misplaced expression of memorializing fallen soldiers.  It's the nation that is at fault for our young men dying. They died because of political and economic interests of our elites... led astray by the propaganda and lies by the government.  It's ironic to hold up national flags in remembrance of the fallen. It's satanic to fly a government symbol in church - especially in glory of war.
post.body_html:
I was wondering what your thoughts are on churches that express resounding patriotism and hanging up symbols of a nation as opposed to church symbols.

This past memorial day, flags were lined in the parking lots and next to the pulpits and I just think of the misplaced expression of memorializing fallen soldiers. It's the nation that is at fault for our young men dying. They died because of political and economic interests of our elites... led astray by the propaganda and lies by the government. It's ironic to hold up national flags in remembrance of the fallen. It's satanic to fly a government symbol in church - especially in glory of war.
post.title: Patriotism and the church
